TopicTitle: Can someone send me an english language dictionary?

Articles.Content: I tried to change a language and deleted an english dictionary file and when I open the game, everything is named by a computer name, some auto_sth123, this translation isn't a good one so I ask someone to send me this one file please xD I can't do file check couse it's not on steam unfortunately :(

2 hours ago, Michaks91 said:

I tried to change a language and deleted an english dictionary file and when I open the game, everything is named by a computer name, some auto_sth123, this translation isn't a good one so I ask someone to send me this one file please xD I can't do file check couse it's not on steam unfortunately

The EULA specifically forbids sharing of SQUAD assets to other users.   Since you're on steam though, this is a very simple fix.   Right click KSP from your steam library -> Properties -> Local Files -> "Verify Integrity of Game Files".    This will reinstall any missing files you might have.

Since you're on steam though
couse it's not on steam


...


Since you're NOT on Steam though, your best bet would be to extract the missing files from the archive(s) you originally installed it from.

The files you probably deleted are
KSP/GameData/Squad/Localization/dictionary.cfg
and
KSP/GameData/SquadExpansion/MakingHistory/Localization/dictionary.cfg
KSP/GameData/SquadExpansion/Serenity/Localization/dictionary.cfg
depending on whether you have the DLC installed or not.

If that sounds too complicated, it's probably best to simply redownload and reinstall KSP at the same location.

9 hours ago, Corax said:

Since you're NOT on Steam though

Whoopsie.
